The partner will provide technical assistance to in country organization Zimbabwe National Quality Assurance Program (ZINQAP) to strengthen capacity for proficiency testing to public health laboratories in Zimbabwe. Activities will require coordinating with MOHCC and integrating ZINQAP activities and reporting into the national laboratory strategic plan. Implementation of quality assurance for HIV rapid testing sites through development of algorithm policy and job aids, review of current training curriculum, training of nurses in rapid HIV testing and implementation of use of Dried Tube Specimens for EQA will be supported by partner with various stakeholders.
The partner will provide support and technical input for implementation of Strengthening Laboratory Management toward Accreditation (SLMTA) & a laboratory mentorship program will be coordinated through various stakeholders including the Medical Laboratory Scientists Council of Zimbabwe (MLSCZ) to improve the quality of laboratory services and attain accreditation. Furthermore the partner will build the capacity of the Medical Laboratory Scientist Council of Zimbabwe (MLSCZ) to act as an in-country accreditation body for the district-level laboratories to help ensure sustainability for this program. Assess and recommend initiatives to strengthen the National Microbiology Reference Laboratory (NMRL) and advice on a strategy for NMRL to attain accreditation.
The partner will also support optimal utilization of laboratory services in providing quality and reliable diagnostic testing to support the HIV/AIDS program in Zimbabwe. Centralized testing at four provincial laboratories will be augmented with sample transport networks to improve & increase access to CD4, chemistry, and hematology testing for ART patients
